H0.text: Muscle is the tissue composed of long, slender protein strands that are essential for contracting and relaxing, illustrating how form follows function.

H1.text: Tendons are long, slender protein strands that make up the tissue essential for contracting and relaxing, illustrating how form follows function.

H2.text: Veins are long, slender protein strands that are essential for contracting and relaxing.

H3.text: Ligaments are long, slender protein strands that make up tissue essential for contracting and relaxing, illustrating how form follows function.

A4.text: The myofibrils are long protein bundles about one micrometer in diameter.

A5.text: The primary function of muscle is contraction.
